definition: person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse

sentences.english: Both men had direct contact with dead chickens when feeding carcasses to their dogs.
sentences.chinese: 这两名男子均在将死鸡尸体喂狗时直接接触了死鸡。

sentences.english: Early today, the body of a 25-year-old man was found in West Town.
sentences.chinese: 今天一早，在西城发现一具25岁男子的尸体。

sentences.english: Placing dead bodies in a bone room.
sentences.chinese: 将尸体放置在尸骸存放屋。

sentences.english: It's carrion! Who killed that man?
sentences.chinese: 不过是一具腐烂的尸体罢了，谁杀了这个人？

sentences.english: This is the phobia or fear of death as such or any dead objects.
sentences.chinese: 这种恐惧症的源头是对死亡或者尸体的害怕。

sentences.english: A dead body revenges not injuries.
sentences.chinese: 只有尸体才不会为受到的外伤而报复。

sentences.english: They claimed that the boy strangled her before moving her body outside.
sentences.chinese: 他们称男孩勒死了她然后将尸体拖出去。

sentences.english: Dozens of dead cats were found in plastic bins around the house.
sentences.chinese: 从散落在屋里的塑料箱内还发现了几十只猫的尸体。

sentences.english: He wanted to see this grotesque sight, these dead bodies lying there.
sentences.chinese: 他想要看到这种怪诞的景像，这些尸体躺在那儿。

sentences.english: They were carrying four or five at a time.
sentences.chinese: 他们一次要运出来四五具尸体。

sentences.english: Roger went across to the bed and put his hand on her arm.It was cold.
sentences.chinese: 罗杰走到床前把手放在她的手臂上，尸体已经冷了。

sentences.english: These voracious scavengers work together to strip the carcasses of large animals.
sentences.chinese: 这些贪婪的食腐鸟类共同协作，分食大型动物的尸体。

sentences.english: He mutilated the nun and stuffed into a closet.
sentences.chinese: 他杀了一名修女，他碎尸然后把尸体赛进柜子。

sentences.english: The body was placed in bier before burial.
sentences.chinese: 在举行葬礼以前尸体被放在棺材里。

sentences.english: He then brings her heart home to feed his dog.
sentences.chinese: 随后他将尸体的心脏带回家喂狗。

sentences.english: Well,that's why we said up here that in Phase C when there's a corpse,I don't exist.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们说在C阶段作为尸体，我并不存在。

definition: person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse
